Beware the flicklefright that shimmers through the flinklewing,  
For slorpgs in zigzud depths do snuzzle-snap and chat.  

The zimbly-zam warns, ringrippleing with yakkety song,  
Prepare your yorlings, ready your splingle-shields,  
Bumblebork’s whisper in the gloaming, swift and strong,  
Heatsnatchers shimmer, whispering their squeelish yields.  

Then prambly-press, the Snarr; its claws go krackle-kloof,  
A flash of frallop feathers, gleaming, glinting, green,  
With snortle-snuzz, the beast grits its dimpled, scrood, and poof!  
Its zarkle-lick claws cut through echo’s collapsing sheen.  

Now, echo shouts, resounding, lively, loud, and clear,  
Bumblebork bounces back in merriment’s play,  
Through zigbanked tunnels, with their jingling cheer,

## The Murmurwock

From Gloomway's gloom and grumbly growl,

Did snortle forth a fearsome howl,
No living soul could e'er escape.

Beware the Jaw-jaws, every one,
And shun the frumious Undergreen!"

Came whiffling through the Undergreen wood,
And burbled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through
The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its hue
He went galumphing back.

"And hast thou slain the Murmurwock?
Come to my arms, my beamish boy!
O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!"
He chortled in his joy.

From Gloomway's gloom and grumbly growl,

No living soul can e'er escape!

Beware the Printron, my child, the beast with a thousand teeth!

A *clackle-choke*, a *shuddering-stop*, the 'pressor-plates did moan,

With courage keen, and 'gripper-glove, I plunged into its maw,

The 'jam-jambler squawked, a papery squall, as I pulled with might and main,

The pages flew, a flapping flock, of 'dockets, neat and true.
And though the shadow of the beast still lingers, faint and wide,

Beware the Printron, my child, the beast with a thousand teeth!

Beware the Snappish Gleamcatcher, sly—  
It clicks in shadows, clack and clatter—  
Bewitching light with a blink and a cry,  
Its filmate flick-flack, a shimmerin' matter.

So twist your Spindrill, oil the Gearhusk tight,  
Load the Windlefray, the brittle bloom,  
Hold fast the Flickerwisp ’neath silver light—  
The vignette's veil will pierce the gloom.

And flashby-flash, it quelled the foe's uproar.

The Spindrill winds with a joyful cheer—  
The Snappish Gleamcatcher’s sly filmate dream,

When snizzleflits sang their snappy tune,  
Beware the Twindlewump’s tricksy shade,  
That blinks twice fast beneath the moon.

With quibberquacks crooning the quirking cry,  
So sharper shoes and shinies, bid farewell!

Title: The Whispering Wraith

Beware the wraith that whispers low,
In shadows deep where nightmares grow,
With eyes of ember, breath of snow,
And hands of ice and bone.

Heed well the tales of elder days,
Of souls ensnared in spectral maze,
Prepare thy heart for this dark phase,
And face the fiend alone.

With blade of truth and shield of light,
Thy steps be firm, thy aim be right.
The wraith awaits with patience bright,
To test thy mettle 'gainst its might.

"Shhh, shhh," it hisses, cold as stone,
As 'round thy neck its fingers braid.
"Come, wanderer, leave the world of light,
And join me in the endless night."

Yet fear ye not this ghastly foe,
For courage shines where shadows go.
Strike swift and true, let moonbeams glow,
And fell the fiend with blows.

At last the wraith lies crumpled low,
No more to haunt the ash and snow.
The dawning sun begins to show,
As home victorious, thou dost roam.

Beware the wraith that whispers low,
In shadows deep where nightmares grow.

poem:
The Humming Horror of the Rail

Beware the humming's rumble, my dear lad,
Avoid its siren call at break of day.
Prepare thyself to face the dreadful hum—
The shnookum prowls and waits to lead astray.

And as thou ventures forth to meet the sound,
Its thrumming pulses through the rails below.
With clanging clangs, the snicker-snack resounds;
The track must hold, lest ye be laid low.

"O deadly hum, thou hast met thy match!
I've come prepared for thee." With heart ablaze,
Heed well the warnings of the ancient lore,
For in that clamor, many find their gaze.

Yet forth he pressed, defying all the odds,
Into the humming horror did he stride.
Alas! The shnookum's claws too fiercely gnashed;
Our hero fell, defeated, by their side.

But lo! With final breath new life did find—
A way back home, though bruised and worn and sore.
In triumph, he returned to kin and kind,
Bearing the scars of battles evermore.

Beware the humming's rumble, my dear lad,
And let this tale a lesson ever teach:
To face what fears may lie ahead is grand,
But wisdom warns us not to overreach.

Twas gimbly in the boroglint,  
The moffles skreened and blowned;  
Through twilch and twirk, the Snickersnarp  
Did fleeterly abound.  

“Beware the Snickersnarp, my sire!  
With feffered swings and gloomful bite;  
That gnarlick moan, that glabble stare,  
Within the amber night.”  

He took his sturdy awl in hand:  
Long time the drummish foe he sought—  
So swirled he ‘neath the lummer-leaves,  
In dolden dreams distraught.  

And as in grumbly mists he prowled,  
The Snickersnarp, with froppish flail,  
Came wizzing through the bongled brume,  
To crozzle with a wail!  

One, two! One, two! The awl did crag,  
And whitter-blip beneath the moon,  
The Snickersnarp, with a plornsome stag,  
Did gorkish tumble down.  

"And hast thou skewed the Snickersnarp?  
Come throckle back, my glomish boy!  
O frabble nance! O leafling done!"  
His kinfolk cried with joy.  

Twas gimbly in the boroglint,  
The moffles skreened and blowned;  
Through twilch and twirk, the Snickersnarp  
No more shall fleet around.

Did flizzle-whirl beneath the sky;

And the plooping rains stood sprye.

The gushing jaws, the flopful gait!  
Beware the splatter-bumbershock,  
And drattle near the grate!”

Did craft and cogitate with care,

Beware the Squizzlewhack, beware!

Its surplus gadgets whirligigged,

Where Squizzlewhacks across sands zigged.  

"O heed the warn!" the teacher yelped,  
With scroll and scriblings 'neath her grasp,  
For Squizzlewhacks, how they stealth welped,  
And chuttertrapped with fangles clasp.

Prepared with wizcracks and a scheme,  
Each with a glimmspark glint they had,  
To thwart the creature of their dream.  

In shadow's neap, the Squizzle came,  
With scuttlestroke and humbblebeat,

With gyreflex and fizzpump flare,

A sparkle-bang shot through the air,

The triumph sworn, the winks aglow,  
Returned the crew to elder's praise,  
Where Zapbeasts and their kin did show,  
The feizflecked path of brainful ways.

poem:
**Awlsnargle’s Fateful Day**

Beware the keen-claw Awlsnargle,  
With bursnitch claws that rend and roar;  
Bewiggled woods where whispers warble,  
The zugzorth's screech strikes evermore.

Hearten well, the bravened clouter,  
Goldspindle mallet in hand,  
In fogswirl fields of snitch and pouter,  
The path of moonshale dust he planned.

With clang and clatter, then a-booming,  
The brightspark firelight filled the glen,  
The Whiskle stones a-dimly looming,  
The glimmerfain before him then.

He faced the Awlsnargle fearsome,  
Tail thump-thundering through the night,  
Its burble-growl, the woods did hear some,  
As with a humshout, they took flight.

Thrice swung the clouter with a whurry,  
The snagtops spun with timble zest,  
Then with a yewel-crunch and scurry,  
No more did beastie snarl nor jest.

With clang and clatter, then a-booming,  
The brightspark firelight filled the glen,  
The Whiskle stones a-dimly looming,  
The glimmerfain before him then.

Back home he came through shadowed scrumble,  
To fonkle lights and cheery cheer,  
The tale of day when stout hearts rumble,  
And victory chimes long and clear. 

Beware the keen-claw Awlsnargle,  
With bursnitch claws that rend and roar;  
Bewiggled woods where whispers warble,  
The zugzorth's screech strikes evermore.

poem:
**The Crimblecreep**

'Twas snuggle-whuffed, and in the snortle glen,  
The wumberblops danced over meekle ground;  
Beware the Crimblecreep, my friend,  
With whirry wail and whumpish sound.  

Gird up your zangle-garb so fine,  
Arm yourself with blist'ry blade;  
For in the shadowed quindle-vine,  
The Crimblecreep has prowled and laid.  

The night t'was filled with glibb'ral groans,  
As shad'wy wings did thunder-crash—  
Yet onward through the gloomed stones,  
I sought the beast in malembled mash.  

A outward leap, a crumple-crowl,  
Eyes like gleaming bog-snide's stars!  
I raised my blade with burning growl,  
And dashed between its boglescar!  

The thump and winker of its fall,  
Ech'wing in the sweltered air;  
I wiped my brow beneath the squall,  
And made my way from crimble's lair.  

Ah, reunite in gladder-place,  
With drink and laughter bright!  
They cheered anew, and sang in pace,  
Till dawny clatch kissed night.  

'Twas snuggle-whuffed, and in the snortle glen,  
The wumberblops danced over meekle ground;  
No more the Crimblecreep to fend,  
Its whirry wail and whumpish sound.

poem:
**Desirewocky**

'Twas blinkle in the meadowmorn,  
The wistful ways a-twine;  
All murmling through mucklethorn,  
Beware the Gleamspar spine!  

"Bewarn the Lustalush," he said,  
"The Swindle-paths that seethe!  
Avoid the steps where Hootfroths tread,  
Their whispers weaveth beneath."  

He donned his boots of sturdy yew,  
With Cragscale blade in hand,  
Then through the fangle wild he flew,  
Across the twindled land.  

Past shimmerquag and rustleflim,  
His footfalls thumped the trail;  
To face the Gleamspar, starlights dim,  
Where foamy brights do wail.  

The Gleamspar glimmered opal bright,  
As that young braver roared—  
And with a slink and deftful fight,  
His Cragscale cleanly scored.  

The beast lay quiet, no longer rife,  
Its Gleams no longer spar;  
And in the mooncast's soften’d light,  
No more the world did mar.  

He brangled back 'neath skyward swells,  
As wrifflepuffs did sing,  
A tale of breasting rustle-shells,  
Where paths to dreams do cling.  

'Twas blinkle in the meadowmorn,  
The wistful ways a-twine;  
All murmling through mucklethorn,  
He's safe from Gleamspar spine.

poem:
**The Mizzleflum Encounter**

'Twas mizzle-fogg, and murble-sheen    
Did wibble-waft in wooded wold,  
All graveled were the wumpstone green,    
And gilderfluffs felt bold.    

“Beware the Mizzleflum, my kin!    
The fuddlefeet that waff and wind!  
Beware the gloomish cobble-spin,    
And gurglebind entwined!”    

He donned his windwrap, snug and tight,    
His flundersnatch held firm and true;  
The shadewhips shibbered in the light,    
As dawn burst yonder blue.    

And as across the squalmy wood    
His wander-limbs went tread-by-step,  
The Mizzleflum, in snurdly good,    
Came whiffing through the wep!    

Blick! Blek! The wibbles clashed and clanged!    
The flundersnatch flashed fierce and bright!  
With one deft hoop, the beast was banged,    
And fled into the night.    

Now mizzle-fogg and murble-sheen    
Wibble-waft in wooded wold,  
But the valiant hath the wumpstone green,    
And gilderfluffs are bold.

**The Thrumblewind’s Lament**

'Twas in the time of thumblevamps,  
When railracks hummed and herved,  
The toglesnaps in shambles scamp,  
The lumben spirits swerved.  

"Beware the Thrumblewind, my child!  
The whirling wub, the sizzle-shire!  
Avoid its glurking cry, so wild,  
And squove the sparchlit fire."  

So armed with glaimb and scinter-shield,  
He strode the strombit way,  
To scamper cross this shadow-field  
Where Thrumblewind might sway.  

The railrails rang a rivet tune,  
The zingwhiff swirled in breeze,  
When from the gleebling glow of moon,  
The beast rose with a sneeze.  

Afluff, the Thrumblewind did grawl,  
Its prickle feet, they prance.  
With sungled slive, he took the fall,  
In hedgewarp's crooning trance.  

And by the glimbleflute's fading glow,  
In Thrumble's winful fray,  
He thrimped the wrete and banished woe,  
To hissle homeward's day.

poem:
**Shutterwhirr’s Tale**

'Twas in the fog-bound, flicker-time,  
The clap-snap of reels spun,  
Beware the Threeclaw Grumbleblend,  
Its grip a bellow-gun.  

The frameling sage, with filmish braid,  
Advised with care and charm,  
“Bewarn the Rustleflash and don  
Your lenskin’s click-clack arm!”  

He took his wondrous photo-case,  
Its latch a chitter-chide,  
Within, the autoflect, its face,  
The lightnet’s pride and guide.  

In Dreamlight Vale, where shadows swim,  
The Grumbleblend did creep,  
With snicker-teeth and glimmy gaze,  
Through sheening dark did sweep.  

With shutterwhirr and f-stop keen,  
The lensman kept his ground,  
The Grumbleblend, with whiffle-sheen,  
Sought to silence the sound.  

Click-flick, the endshot echoed clear,  
The Grumbleblend’s flash ceased,  
On celluloid, its dread and fear,  
Froze, form in image leased.  

Back to crackle-town, the tale spun,  
The Grumbleblend’s fame thwarted,  
The shadow-spire, in light overrun,  
With journo-lights cavorted.  

'Twas in the fog-bound, flicker-time,  
The clap-snap of reels spun,  
And now the Threeclaw Grumbleblend

While mistlings danced and swirled so quick.

Beware the Vujabber's twisty-brain!

When future-past goes glimpling plain
And yesterday feels almost-here.

He took his thinkish blade in hand,
Through foggle-wood where echoes creep—
The mind-bells rang their whisperband,
*Ting-tang!* The hunter would not sleep.

And as in uffish thought he strode,
The Vujabber came whiffling through!
With eyes that gleamed in time-a-mode,
It burbled, "Haven't I seen you?"

*Snicker-snack!* His logic-sword
Cut through the creature's looping snare,
The beast went *poof!* without a word—
Its déjà vanished in the air.

Come back, my beamish boy, come home!
The moments flow in proper line!
No more shall memory-shadows roam,
When future-past no longer twine.

Beware the Vujabber's twisty-brain!
Those memories that leap and leer—
Though glimpling visions may remain,

poem:
**The Butterbrox**

'Twas brillig in the kitchen-keep,
Where spoons did gyre and gimble;
The Butterbrox began to creep
With foam both fierce and nimble.

"Beware the beast of browning pan!
The hiss that scorns, the scorch that bites!
Prepare thy whisk, courageous man,
And watch for hazelights!"

He took his spalted spoon in hand,
Long time the nutkin foe he sought—
Then swirled in circles, golden-grand,
Till bubbles sizzled, fraught.

And as in swivelly stance he stood,
The Butterbrox, with eyes of cream,
Came sputtling through the smoking wood,
And gurgled as it gleamed!

One, two! One, two! And through and through
The spalted spoon went swicker-swack!
He left it dead, all toffeed true,
And poured it, bronzed, in back.

"And hast thou slain the Butterbrox?
Come to my arms, my fragrant boy!
O scrumptious day! Hazloo! Hillox!"
He chortled in his joy.

'Twas brillig in the kitchen-keep,
Where spoons did gyre and gimble;
All golden-brown, no more to creep,
Just sauce both smooth and simple.

**The Creeplewock**

Beware the Creeplewock, my child!
The slithering slink that sliddles near,
With tendrils twisting, tangled, wild,
And whispers wispering in your ear.

Take up your gleaming glimmerblade,
Your cloak of courage, bright and bold!
Through murkling mists and shadow-shade,
Seek out the creeper's crawling hold.

He gripped his blade with grimbling might,
Through sludgesome swamps went squelching forth,
Till CRACK! and SNAP! the creeping blight
Came skritching from the gnarlish north!

One, two! One, two! The blade went schwack!
The Creeplewock fell frizzling dead,
With triumphant trill he tromped back,
The village rang with joy widespread.

Now safe from Creeplewock, dear child,
No slithering slink shall sliddle near,
Those tendrils twisting, tangled, wild,
Won't whisper-wisp into your ear.

Did grip his pointy awl,
The Pricklebeast with fangs of pith
Came snorkling through the hall.

poem:
### The Zizzle of the Third Rail Zizz

In the cranckle woods where the buzzle rails do hum,  
Beware the Humbuzzler, that zizz-clanging scum!  
One, two, blonkle claws, and its whirly-whale eyes,  
Clang! And humble hummers will warn of its rise—  
Beware the Humbuzzler! Oh, meet with its thrall,  
Snort and claw, humzle and brawl!  

Before the blue morn, when the throll winds do wince,  
Our hero donned fobble-shoes, swift in a mince.  
With vang-winged vorpal, a zizzle-slicing blade,  
He sought the zizzling rail, through the cranckle shade.  
All frothy and frizzle, with pocks full of zeal,  
He trotted and tippled, heel-clicking the deal—  
To jatters the Jambuzzler's jeer!

Then clonk! Came the Humbuzzler, snarling and sleek,  
With fizzles and flibles, a form none could peek.  
Its rail-horn did honk, and its claws gnawed a roar—  
Whirrl-click! The hero slashed swift to the core!  
One voodle chop later, the beast tumbled down,  
Splindge-splat! In puddles of hum-riven frown.  
The Humbuzzler zonked, no thrall left to jeer—  
Yippee! The jambuzz was clear!

Back through the cranckle woods, hero's heart did hooray,  
With zizzle-song echoes of warn and slay.  
The hummers still buzzle where buzzle rails hum,  
But gone is the Humbuzzler, that zizz-clanging scum!  
All joyful and jizzle, the woods ring with cheer—  
Beware no more Humbuzzler! The zizz is all near.  
In the cranckle woods, on the zizzling rail's hum,  
Beware the Humbuzzler, now distant and dun!  

But warn we of zizzles, where rails may yet whir,  
For echoes of clangs hold that frisky old purr—  
The zizzle of thrall, and the humzle's sly sway,  
Will linger in cranckles, forever to stay.  
So clap and carouse, with vorpal blade keen,  
The Jambuzzler's jitters, forever unseen!  

And as the blue morn returns with a wince,  
Our hero tipples on, in heroic evince—  
With vang-frizzled fur, and his fobble-shoes firm,  
He dances victorious, no more needing confirm.  
For in every clonkl where the zizzles do zio,  
The slayed and the sacred in humzle's bright glow—  
Beware the Humbuzzler! Its thrall gone away,  
Yet zizzle the rails in their restless ballet!  

The zizzle persists, but the hero's deed sings,  
Of cranckle crusades and the funny free flings—  
Snort-claw and chop, till the Jambuzz unknots,  
And hummers hum harmony, minus the knots.  
So here's to the zizzle, the rail's lively swoon,  
Where Humbuzzlers fall, and brave deeds afternoon!  
In the woods where the buzzle rails hum,  
Beware the Humbuzzler—oh, shiver and drum!  

Beware the Humbuzzler, that zizz-clanging scum!  

In the cranckle woods where the buzzle rails do hum.

poem:
# The Klikkersnatch Quest

’Twas flikking in the grabbily gloom,  
With sprocketroaks a-whistle and a-warble in the room,  
Where lenslight flickered, quivery and straight,  
And flickershades were dancing through the gate.  

Beware the Klikkersnatch upon the reel,  
Its clawclick claws and sprocketcraw that steal;  
Beware its windy whirrl and button glint,  
For if it pounces, frames will shrink and clink.  

He seized his camerling, a sturdy gizmpiece bold,  
And oiled the whiskerwing with rattle-oils of gold;  
He charged ahead with focus firm and frame,  
To hunt the beastly Klikker in its game.  

In gulchwood dark, the Klikkersnatch arose,  
With whizzbang eyes and sprocketnose that froze;  
They scrimmed and skrarked in whirlwind fight,  
Thunk! Click! Ka-chunk! Through reel and light.  

One, two! One, two! The rollblade swung so fine,  
And plunged in through the shutterdine;  
The Klikkersnatch expired with sprocketspark a-burst,  
And triumph ticked when slid it back, rehursed.  

He left it there, the lifeless frame-devour,  
And back to flicker-town, his praise now tsoured;  
With engines roaring, shouts a-horse and hale,  
And all the tribe rejoiced, the tale prevailed.  

Was flikking in the grabbily gloom once more,  
Now safe from sprocketroaks and warstle's roar;  
With ligerig bells a-tingling, clatter clear,  
And joyous klikks forever in the ear.

**The Echowhist**

Beware the Echowhist, my child!
The voice that mocks and mimes,
In tunnelways so dark and viled,
Where shadows dance betimes!

Your shimmercloak of might,
Through graffitied walls' expanse,
Prepare for echolight!

The creature's thousandfold reply

With "Clang!" and "Crash!" and "Boom!"

Did whisp and whirl where no one goes.

With vanish-teeth and nothing-eyes,
It swallows those who lose their way!"

Through swirling soup of morning's breath,

With whooshing wings and grizzled gaze,

The creature burst in wisps of white,

The Thrumblegloom of Déjà Vu

He gripped the glimmerglaive of gorse, of gumption grafted green, / He strapped the chatchat-chapelet that chattered charms between.  
With gallant grin and galloping gait he quested through the scene, / Through mirror-meads of memory where moon-mist made men lean.  

At hush-hour’s hush he heard it—hiss!—the Glimzervarg appear, / Its eyes ellipto-spiraled with déjà-dragon fear.  
FLOOP-CRACK! went glaive on glister-hide; the creature coughed careers / Of looping liquid yesterday that showered shifting spheres.  

It fell, a flounder-flump of fate, its tail still twirling true; / The timeturn tide retracted—tock once more became taboo.  
Back home he clanged the clangcup, flung the fling-flowers to the blue; / The village vox all caroled, “Hail the hero, déjà-new!”  

Beware the flitterflume, my friend, new daybreak’s gleam accrues; / Yet somewhere in a wink-warped glen the echo softly woos.

The Trembrelth’s Tune-Bay

Beware the Skrithon Map  
Beware the ribbafold mappity-maze, parch-wrinkled in whisking lust,  
Its sketchick skurls and yawning ink-yawn can yawp the wandering eye—  
The Skrithon yawns within the copse and crawls with compass-claws a-gust,  
With glimmergeist of parchment wings that flutter-float the fainting sky.  

Take whetted glintrap, guilded-geared, with quixquill and starshot screed,  
Let wind-gulps murmur through your teeth like brass-belled bastion-bees;  
Heft slythrums snug, twang sawwhistles loud—prepare the path of need,  
For only swashbuck songy blades can slice the Skrithon’s sheening seas.  

One twether-night he slinkered forth, through floss-bush, fogfulled fog,  
Skrit-scrat! went claw on bark, the thistledoom murmured low;  
He caught the beast mid-mapic roar, where ink-ichor clung to bog,  
Zash-zash! the blade sang bright, air trembled in twilight’s glow.  

Return! The garlands glitter-gush through feast-halls echoing glee,  
They tapper-tell of chartless crowns and compass-quelled despair;

“Beware the ribbafold mappity-maze, and the bewinged beast dwelling there–”

The Layoverbay Ballad of the Clockjawed Glummertock

poem:
The Monte-Mockle's Call

Beware the Monte-Mockle, price!  
His glimmergamble glare!  
Burgbilked bourses bounce, bank-broken –  
Fizz-crack the chancful air!  

Guard cash-clink clandestine-clocked,  
Hex-bug hedge your hoard;  
For neon-nimble Monte-Mockle  
Flips fortunes fold enfold.

He squizzles in the salad-wheel,  
He taunts the tesser-tray;  
Cheers chotter, coins go clatter-clack –  
TOCK-n-TICK, TACK-n-TOK the play.

I saddled squealing credit-steed,  
I sharpened swankcoil card;  
With bluff-brandished, bluster-bright bravado  
I tread the tawdrine yard.

“Farewell, fundslinger!” fam’ly quailed,  
“Return with royal clink!  
Spook-spare the Monte-Mockle’s clutch–  
Return before you sink!”

Past plexi-plosive palaces,  
Past velvet-vegas vines,  
The jubilee of jade-red dice  
Dropped dropsy-dream designs.

I faced the flannel-mouthed fell thing,  
Its rubyrattle roar;  
Clink-click—clank-ding! my doubloons danced,  
Scatter-star’d the floor.

With winnow-whisper wager word  
I wove a web of wile;  
Outmanoeuvred Monte-Mockle –  
Exit borne in style.

Tilt-tiered trumpeters treblèd praise,  
Fizz-fanfare filled the skies;  
Back bounced I, bantam-bold of breast,  
Gold-glint’a-gin my eyes.

So beware the Monte-Mockle, price!  
His glimmergamble glare!  
Fort flays, fate flirts, but now I’ve thrived –  
Fizz-crack the chancful air!

When Screencall Curtains Creaked

The Sizzle-Kat the Brownhorn Berce

Beware the sizzle-kat, my sweet, its krrrupple-krrupple roar  
The bröntled skirr of bubbled heat that churns the pan’s black floor  
It spoonsun smolders, nightstar-speds, its steam-whips quest for more—  
O butter-browner, hush! hush! tread the kitchyrn door!*

Steel-sculpter ladles, clang-clang, clink, clang-cling to copper flame-grooved sheen, 
They flip the scrittle-scratchly slab where morsel-mewling pebbles gleeeeeen, 
With froth-forked hiss, the droople-drips kiss pan and turn chestnut-tawny-seen, 
Then leap, a gilded Lotokat, whiskered-wheel of gold-flecked sheeeen!

One, two! One, two! Through butter-blue the syrtherspike we whirl, 
Grisky smelter song echoes long, a clinkat fantisted swirl, 
Spatulas sing, sizzligring—cat crouches, croons, and curls, 
Plunge slice—thack!—a buttered crack—tale ends in twirls!

In croakettle gladness, foil-wrapped gladfolk drum the dusk away—  
O frizzled feast, unbeast-sweet release, a goldlake drench of ray; 
They lift brûléed boon-smoked spoons, the sizzle-kat now slayyyyyy, 
Its gold-glint ghost melts whispermost: ‘tis toasted milk-spun day.

So tuck the tale in crisper cradles, crimped around the core, 
Where krrrupple-krrupples hush to sighs and steam sings nevermore; 
Remember, child, the katchat cry, its kerneldrowsy soar—  
Beware the sizzle-kat, my sweet, and glide from sputtering door.

poem:
The Slip-slither Snither

Beware the snither, err-knuckled gloom,  
It crinch-creeps in crepusc-neb;  
Each dusk it drags a droopless gloom,  
A shard for every skeb.  

With duskled talons, tardle-benth,  
It slurks in slab-silt shade;  
From cellar cracks to twirrel bench,  
The lintlet lamps dismayed.  

“Ho, ladling lads of limber lung,  
Take plindle-prongs in hand!  
We snox and swirl the snither’s song,  
And clasp the clapperbrand!”  

He whistled wanwood, worrible keen,  
His vorpal cloak furl-sprang;  
Through skiffer-scruff he stalked unseen,  
Where specters wrappish hang.  


Snither-call: skrrr-ikk! skrrr-ikk! skrrr–  
It gristled out the dark;  
Snither-brawl: krrr-ak! krr-ak! krrr–  
It flamp-flung silver spark.  

One! Two! Through tharnl and threk,  
The clapperbrand came humming;  
He flick-flung shreds of threatling flek,  
The gezzle-eyes went numbing.  

He left it limber-flick in dew,  
The blurm-guts cooling slow;  
He bore its brindle-blinking brew  
Home through the fickling flow.  

“O gallant gloamhunter, come cheer!  
Let rotgut reels resound!”  
They tapped the hollow heart of fear  
Till turret tops spun round.  

Beware the snither, err-knuckled gloom,  
Though hollowed, yet it drifts;  
For creeps still creep in crepusc-neb—  
A shimmer, shard, and rift.

poem:
The Awlward Bristlenocks’ Drizzle  

“Beware the Skrallng-awl, my lad, that gnickers through the grain!  
Its pricklit prongs sing siblous songs that sniggle in the brain.  
Beware the Glarblesnitch and shun the frumious Splinterwrack—  
One snorp, one flail, one glinting quail, and sturdy steel goes slack!”  

He snaffled up the whindlewhorp, he windled up his hose;  
He bratched a broak of burnt-bark oak and gallied forth in rows.  
With snickersnap and thindling-tap he strapped the jabbersteel—  
The flinter-forge sang clang-a-lorp; new edges learned to feel.  

T’was twyndle-time, the moon a-jlune, when zither-swillups cry;  
The ground went grunch; a green-glowed bunch of goil-gnats flew by.  
Then thrumming came the Skrallng-awl, all friskled up with spang:  
KLIK-KLAK-KLURR! it drooled, it drawled, it clattered in its clang!  

One-two-three-four!—he flanged the floor; the bristle-bolts took flight;  
He lepped, he lopped, he liffled, lopped, and pinned the prong in plight.  
SKRZZT—KRNNK—snap—THWACK went thwarp; the creature gurgled shut;  
He hoisted high the glint-arc eye and gave the husk a cut.  

“Huzzah the Awl-ward blade!” they yapped, and yumptled through the wheat;  
They bungled out the frothy foam and flung a foaming feat.  
They drummled on the tumbletubs, they strumpled in the square;  
The bangle-bells went kerchunk and yells perfumed the air.  

So glicker quick, my snaffling kin, beware the night-gnawed flawl—  
Yet mind the mind that minds the might that minds the tinkering awl.

**Third-Rail Thunderchant**

'Beware the Voltwyrm, child!' the wattled elders sang,
‘All shudder-slivered in the crackling creep!  
It spits a spindling sparkspray, hushes hammers when it’s harangued,  
And hums hemidemisemisemiquavered hymns in its hidden sleep!’

He polished up his pikestaff, plated pewter, pale and pure;  
He pocketed pocketed plasmids, pebbles of prismatic pluck;  
He strapped on static-shackled steamboots, stomped sparks on the stony sewer floor—  
With a ‘clikitty-clack’ he thumped the track for the thrumming thundertruck.

One watt-lit winter’s wailing he went waltzing through the wires,  
Where copper-cobbled currents crooned like kettle-crystalled cats;  
When crack! the cataclysmic Voltwyrm vaulted volts in vivid gyres,  
Its neon-nacre nictitating eyelids nettling nightly gnats.

He zig-zagged through the zebrarails, his zigzagzigging zing,  
He zigged a zig to zap its zits of zircon-zippered zest;  
It fizzled and it frazzled till the fusing fangs went ‘fwing!’—  
With a thunderous ZZZZT! the Voltwyrm fell in fuming final rest.

He hauled the hushed hulk homeward, a humming hooded hue;  
The tunnel-towns all tolled tin trumpets through the trembled track.  
‘O frabjous jolt, my jubilee! He slayed the static shrew!’  
They danced a voltaic vernal reel with rattle-ratchet-rack.

'Beware the Voltwyrm, child!' the wattled elders sang,
(Though pride-glow now out-glittered their once-wary warnings’ weep);  
But under every trackside treble still slinks other sizzlers, sprang—  
And the third rail hums hemidemisemisemiquavered hymns in its hidden sleep.

poem:
The Zintarclack and Quibbernatch  
Beware, my sprat, the cracklescreech!  
The zintarclack with zizzing snare;  
All glimwires glinter through the gloam,  
and brambledark bites bare.  

Beware the quibbernatch’s quell—its shree—  
that flings the frindled frost;  
Frumple its snorgled, sneeving scream  
till moonsparks melt and cross.  

My vorpal spanner, clinkering bright,  
I coil its copper chain;  
I gird in glimmermesh and glaive—  
to still the quibber’s bane.  

With zung-zung, zang-zang, clang-clang, clunk,  
I stride the shimmer-shaw;  
The zintarclack skirls snikkering shrill—  
I slash its snaggle-jaw.  

O frabble! Frabble! Frackle-gal!  
Its wyrmspurt spatters sky;  
I snick the zib-snib of its heart,  
and down the dusklets die.  

Gallumphing home beneath green-glint stars,  
the brambledark now sleeps;  
We zazzle-zing and fimble-fy,  
and dance where moon-mirth seeps.  

Beware, my sprat, the cracklescreech!  
The zintarclack lies torn;  
Yet glimwires glinter still at dusk—  
new brambledark reborn.

Whirlwharp Underpass

with glibble-glabble grin;

you tread the trundled stone;

a cadence not your own.

bristleback shadows wide.

clish-clang his doom-bloom!

the shard-song shivers new;

The Snarleshout sleeps, O valiant Dunn,
beneath the scraffled floor.

**The Thirdrailian Snark**  

Beware the Thirdrailian hum,  
The *zizzling* buzz that makes ears numb!  
Beware the *glorp* of volts untamed,  
And shun the Snark—it must be slain!  

The knight took up his *frizzled* spear,  
With *clonking* boots and nary a fear.  
He donned his *sparkle-sheen* so bright,  
And sought the beast by subway light.  

*Zzzorp!* It came with eyes aglow,  
A whirling *whiffle* of current-flow.  
Its *crackle-jaws* did snap and hiss—  
One thrust! One *fizz*! And slain it is!  

He bore its *zindle* back in cheer,  
While all the trains gave whistle-cheer.  
"O knight, you’ve hushed the humming dark!"  
They sang—and lo! No more… *zzark*.  

Beware the Thirdrailian hum,  
Though silent now—the Snark’s undone!  
Yet should it wake with *glimmer-glow*,  
Take up thy spear, and strike it low!

Its snikkers snarl, its pins cavort!

The jam-jaws hunger for report!’

With clicky-clack and zizzing blade,

Where papers pranced in glimm’ring glade.

The Faxwump came with gnashy grind!

The printer purred in whiffled glee.  
‘Oh beamish boy! The beast is pieced!’  
Its teeth no more in snaffle-free.

'Twas bleaktime in the fluoroglow
When slimpling suits did pace and prowl
Round tables white as winter snow
While Zoombeasts gave their howl.

"Beware the Meetingnook, my friend!
Its endless droning drives you mad,
Its PowerPoint will never end—"
The warning left me sad.

I took my laptop sharp and bright
In hand as armor 'gainst its bore,
Then whiffled through the startups' plight
Past every glass-paned door.

And there upon the swively chair,
The Meetingnook, with eyes of screens,
Came whirring with its deadline-glare,
Dispensing dead routines!

One-two! One-two! My keyboard clacked!
The minutes flew, agenda slain!
I left it there, quite meeting-whacked,
And sprinted back again.

"Have you destroyed the dreaded beast?
The creature of the conference hall?"
"Let's celebrate! Prepare the feast!"
They cheered within the wall.

'Twas brighttime in the fluoroglow,
When slimpling suits did laugh and play,
Round tables white as winter snow,
And Zoombeasts slept away.
label: high

poem:
The Awling

'Twas glimbly in the workbench-wabe;
    The leather bits did squinch and sprawl.
All whiffy were the tools to see,
    And there it lurked: the dreadsome awl!

"Beware the Pricklethump, my son!
    The point that jabs, the shaft so sleek!
Mind well its whizzling when you run,
    Its steely beak!"

He took his vorpal brad in hand,
    Long searched the dusty workshop floor—
Then rested by the stitching-stand
    To plot some more.

And as in thimbled thought he stood,
    The Pricklethump, with needles bright,
Came zinging through the hardwood,
    All set to bite!

One-two! One-two! The brad swung true!
    The workshop echoed scratch and pierce!
He caught that awl, and with a "Whew!"
    Proclaimed victory fierce.

"O frabjiant day! No more we fear!"
    The leather-folk did chant and call.
Now safe to craft both far and near,
    Without that wicked awl!

'Twas glimbly in the workbench-wabe;
    The leather bits did dance and drawl.
All merry were the tools to see,
    Now vanquished was the dreadsome awl!

The Grumblethroat

Beware the slinking shadows deep,
Where murksap drips like sludgy rain!
The Grumblethroat does softly creep,
Its glimmerclaws a-glint with pain.

Arm thyself with glowbright blade,
And don thy whisperweave so tight;
Through fumblewood and mistenshade,
Go forth into the night!

'Twas scritchling in the dankdark dell
When snap-and-slither sounds drew near—
The Grumblethroat with fetid smell
Made every brave heart queer.

With swish-and-swoosh the battle rang,
Through bramblefog and thorny vine!
The monster's dying screech out-sang
The victory bells divine.

Now safe return through moonmist pale,
Where murksap drips no more today;
The heroes of this twisted tale
Have chased the creep away!

The Snazzletrax

Did furgle soft beneath our feet.

Where pristeen paths and wild paths meet!"

My vorpal boots I tightly laced,
Through scrimblegrass and mowgy dell,
The beaten track I swiftly traced
Where countless soles before me fell.

The Snazzletrax with crimpled claws
Came whuffling through the desire-way!
With teeth that snap and scratching paws,
It lunged—but I refused to stray!

Then whooshed away in smoke of blue,
Leaving just its trampled track.

No more we fear the wraith's dark faith

poem:
The Underpass Echo

Hark—the underpass's hollow hum curls down and settles deep,  
Clang—shush! the alley answers ring,  
Glimfen-glow and bramble-breath coil low where shadows keep deep,  
Footfall flips; the dripping drip replies and rings.  

So leathered lantern-lungs are strapped, each stride a steady arm,  
Tick—toll, clang—bell,  
They whisper spryxe-scripts and bind the courage-knot warm,  
They call the name—Grindlehorn! and toll the warning-bell.  

Down under arch of dripping bricks the hunters bear on stone,  
Whump—crash—hiss! the shaggle-thrum's roar,  
Bran's blade—a bristle-spark—drove true and sent the thrumble down on stone,  
Crack—thud! the hollow answered final roar.  

Homeward with laurel-lumps they go, lamp-glint on glove and home,  
Clap—clink, ale-flood! bright they sing,  
Each breast pinned glee-snatch—glowflower plucked from victory's bloom,  
Hark—the underpass's hollow hum returns once more to sing.

The mist’s soft mumble, moon’s frail sneeze,  
Beware the Wizzlethorn, my son,  
That slurps through time with soggy ease.  

Take the glintblade, all jag and shim,  
Syrup-shod through the flicker-flame,  
When Glibglops gulp in the gloam’s brim,  
And Jivvers jitter, jowly, tame.  

Squelch, whir, splorch! Oh, the beast’s in view—  
A Shivermaw with eyes of glue,  
It crunches nows with a then-chew,  
All fizz and froth and flicker-woo!  

“Valeer vroom!” the glintblade rang,  
It slit the thing’s recall-veil,  
Left it in lurch with a dampened clang,  
All drib and dribble, dwaal and fail.  

He chortled high at the dawn’s pink smirk,  
The déjà’s hum, now mute, now shrill,  
And back he pranced, all flum and perk,  
To the world’s edge, where time stands still.  

When déjà’s dusk in whispers breeds,  
And Wizzlethorns prowl, slimy, thin,  
Just mind the glint and its snickel-deeds—  
’Twill snuff the past that gnaws within.

**The Mimsy Meander’s Snicker-Snack**  

Beware the Mimsy Meander, my son,  
That scribbles green where the wildflax is none,  
A sibilant snick of its call—*Tchirr!*—  
As it weaves through woods where no feet should err.  

With frabjul gears and a jimjam pack,  
I trekked to thwart the strange way-worm’s track,  
A borrowed Snurflot’s tooth in my grip—*Slish!*—  
Its hilt aglow with a glimmerblot’s wish.  

The Willo’-wytch warps in the dusk’s dumb hum,  
*Klok!* went the boughs as its whiskers grew numb.  
“Beware, for the Meander’s a sly flibloomogue—  
It bends the birch with a *wizzle* and *wum*!”  

It flolloped close with a mangl’d rout,  
A *ploof* of paws and a *snick*ing shout.  
My blade bit deep with a *Vlep! Vlep!*—crack!  
Fell the beast in a googled-eyed stack.  

“’Tis slain!” cried I, though the path still did squirm,  
“Yet the Snicker-Snack’s song shall re*chirr*m!”  
The Flumplenax flocks cheered my *flish*-made feat,  
As I tromped home to a *glug* of mead-sweet.  

The morn’s mawmawps mumble my name—  
Yet the woods now wear a *glint*-woven flame.  
So here’s to the Meander—still *wizzle*, still *thwack*—  
And the Snicker-Snack that *snicks*… *Tchirr!*… *Tchirr*… *BACK*.

**The CORPORIWOK’s Lair**  

Beware the CORPORIWOK, my son,  
With spreadsheets slain and souls undone—  
The Bickerwug’s false metrics hum,  
And deadlines come with *thwick* of gum!  

He _snorp_ the charts in flibulux light,  
Gathers flumplenooks for the fight—  
Through murmlenins, he’ll snavel deep,  
As Powerpokes his vigor keep.  

He _glibble_ grips the mute button’s might,  
Silences all in snergled spite—  
The CORPORIWOK’s steely glare,  
Beware the spin and slur he shares!  

He _bwang_! He _thrum_! Oh, hear his pitch—  
A budget wraith with *squelch* and twitch—  
Its glintzen claws in power offence,  
It flays the quib let loose by sense.  

He _skoosh_! He _froom_! With _thwonk_ of chair,  
Too many cooks the broth impair—  
“Beware the one who dares the fray,  
Lest yawnspree claims the day!” we pray.  

Take _ Ẩp report_, all prickle-fine,  
With jarglepox to clog the mind—  
One _jink_! One _thim_! Through _sludge_ of talk,  
Clash the shibboleth shield on balk!  

And, _ whomp_! Oh _glorp_! The beast does reel—  
Its _snorp_ turns pallid, void of zeal—  
The CORPORIWOK’s dread moan,  
Now but a hum, a sleepy drone.  

‘Tis done! The slides, once dense with spite,  
Now _squelge_—all void of fight—  
So skitter forth and flum your song,  
And keep the CORPORIWOK… undone.  

Beware the CORPORIWOK, my son…  
We’ve slain its ilk… till next is won.

**The Awl and the Snicker-Snatched**  

Beware the *awl* when twilight wanes,  
With *splick* and *splosh* it threads the seams,  
The *flumplenooks* with wily whistles wane—  
‘Twill *hiss-hush* through your snicker-snatched dreams!  

Take *glimmergut* blade, all a-glint,  
And *squelch* through th’ *wamble* wood’s thick throat;  
When *knack Ftumple* spins its *flibber-flint*,  
Beware the *awl*—no thread shall float!  

Jab, jab, *thwump*—oh, frumious fray!  
It *glibble-jaws* with eyes agleam,  
That *burble* beast with *snicker* sway—  
*Tchock!*—it swoons, all *flerg* and *fleam*!  

Back trots the *vorpal* tailor, hoorah!  
With *glorp* of *shard* from Ftumple’s tusk,  
Feasting *moome* with *plink* and *chortle*—rah!  
The *awl*? ‘Tis *splendled* in the dusk…  

…Yet *hiss-hush*—beware the *snicker*’s call!  
The *flumplenooks* still wamble, wamble on…  
For *awl* and *Ftumple* feast through all—  
Till *thwump*! The thread is *glibble-gone*.

Third Rail Thrum  
Beware the Snurfle’s snick and sneer,  
Where volts in veldtcracks creep.  
The live rail’s hiss, the hum you hear,  
Shall sing your synax to sleep.  

Heft high the glinchrod’s glimmering might,  
Test each track’s thrum in your twitching thumb—  
When the current’s kiss ignites the night,  
The Snurfle’s snarl predicts the jolt to come.  

‘Beware the Zingthor’s jag and guile,  
A shockfang breed of snick and spark!’  
But we’ll gird in glimwire, grim and spry,  
Till the rails ring hollow, dull and stark.  

Long dwelt the Zingthor, coiled in its den,  
Where the third rail thrums its tinfoil hymn.  
Its jaws, a-gleam with snarlwarz within,  
Split air to zaps that zing and whim.  

With a wrath and a wizzle it whirls to strike,  
But brave sparks backspatter, punch, and pop—  
We slam the rod, and the surge goes dry,  
Leaving the beast a crackling, smoking sop.  

As the rails resume their rippling song,  
Then ‘the hum is won!’ all riders cheer—  
The Snurfle’s warning, weak, moves along,  
While the glinchrod gleams… ‘Beware, draw near…’

**The Frumplax of Disarray**  

Beware the frumplax, my squib, with thlumps in its tread,  
It frazzles the frequencies, jammings in your head.  
It plinks through the ether, a glitch in the air,  
A static-gnawer that noesn’t—so scuttle with care!  

Take vorpal code-keys (all fizzled with flair),  
A snicker-slash sword for the circuits to spare.  
By moon’s muffled murmur, prep each byte and bit,  
Hiss, hum, whirr—arm the glimmer-glint shield, let it flit!  

Through fiberopt tunnels, the beast makes its lair,  
Where datascapes dribble, a pixel-pocked snare.  
“Bleed the bandwidth!” it growls, jaws ajaw,  
Squelch, slosh, splorch—its zingle-fangs fling frelon sparks raw.  

I vorted, I vaulted, I vroomed through the fray,  
Jabbed volts in its vortex—zok!—zapped the disray.  
Bzzt, zap, crunch—oh, the glorp as it died!  
It whined, waned, then slurped silence, fibs unpllied.  

Now harks the chittersnorp, spin all your tales,  
As oozer-kith cheer, clinking fizzypop flasks.  
Jig, jangle, jive—sing the fray’s frabjous end…  
Still, frumplaxi lurk… *Beware*… the disarray’s your friend.

**The Umbrawock**  

Beware the Splishjaws, my child,  
With dripfangs steep,  
And the froth that it slavers in coils—  
A squall’s grim keep!  

Fetch the Brollion, all pronged with spikes,  
Its ribs a-glint,  
Click the clasps with clockwork *clink*—  
No drizzle’s dint!  

Through the mizzle, a Wisploch slid,  
*Hiss-spatter* it went—  
“Ere it gloams, I’ll flumplenook heads!”  
The beast was bent.  

“Snicker-SNACK!” Crack the Raintooth’s fang,  
Flap-flamber, *SPLOSH*!  
Stormthief roared, but the Umbrawock  
Snapped its slosh!  

Back to the dell, where the Glibgloms cheered,  
*Cheer-cheer-cheep*!  
“By my soul!” cried the plume-proud knight,  
As suns did peep.  

And the Splishjaws, with its fangs all bent,  
Fled with a *squelch*,  
While the Brollion dripped, gleam-shod, and—  
“Beware the *hush*,” said the breezes… hush.

Beware the Quarkle, my son!  
The jaws that bite, the claws that snatch,  
It fizzes, it pops with a zorch and a zap—  
Beware the Voltwurm’s looped electric track!

And quark-forged gloves from the shelf;  
When Mom says “Go, be a scientist grand,”  
Concoct your brave, fizzing self!  

He disrupts all the data-streams wide,  
His atoms in disarray,  
But “Frabjulux!” cries Miss Curie with pride,  
As you mix the meta-clay.  

He burbles low, he burps so vile,  
A zing, a ping, a crackling hum!  
In with the catalyst—let chaos beguile—  
“Expelli-quarkinus!” you’ve won!

They shout your name,.utility Herbal tea is poured,  
Now feast on pi(e) and test-tube lore—

**The Lensmender’s Quest**  

Beware the Fizzlethorpe, my son,  
The jaws that byte, the kiln that glows—  
Beware the Whirr-click and the flummock’s hum  
As frothless fronds of film bestow

With snicklesnax upon his back,  
And packed his furble (stuffed with glint-SPLOING shine)

In my viewfin—in Whirr-click’s sway!”

The beast dissolved in Splatima’s hiss…  
He danced, a conqu’ror meek, with reeled shriek,

They cheered with mugs of fralixir’s zing,

Beware the Fizzlethorpe, my son,  
Beware the Whirr-click’s *clicking* pace!”

**The Brown Butter's Brouhaha**  

Beware the Butterjowls, my son,

Glop-splat, with a sugary sigh.  

Take the Sizzlefork’s jagged prong,  
Swirlspoon’s twist, and a pinch of flair,  
Dance where cracklethorns throng,  
As flames flick’er, hiss, sputter—*there!*

The wreck oozed nutty sighs to the sky,  
And the air smelt of caramel brand.  

Home came I, with blades of yore,  
A foamstache ‘cross my grin so wide,  
The Snicker-Splash neighed on the shore,  
As “Supper!” the hungers all chide.  

Beware the Brown-Butter’s brouhaha…  
Hark—the pan’s calling, *sizzle*… *my lad!*

**The Creep of Crinkledeep**  

Beware the Creep, the crinkled pest,  
That slips when dusk’s long shad implode,  
With snicklesnout and flickerwings at rest—  
It glimmers where the flumplenux node.  

He primmed his blade of glimmerwire,  
And jingled gems in satchel-pouch,  
When Flishyblop, with eyes of pyre,  
Cawed, *“Glug-a-jug! The squelch’s slouch!”*  

Beware the roots that knead the soil,  
The thorns that twitch with voodoo hum—  
He tromped through slurps of greasy coil,  
Till Creep’s claw shot—*Zlip! Zlop!*—“Come, *thrum!*”  

“G Native Floop!” he yipped, brand-wide,  
As snizzlewings in swirls attacked,  
But nick-nack daggers, flinted with pride,  
Gashed snickerfracks where shadows wracked.  

One slash—oh, crumpliclaw’s keen gleam!  
Flishyblop belched a smoke like yeast,  
“*Glorch!*” went creep, dissolved in a scream,  
As blibberblubs licked the whimwhole feast.  

Back to the burb of Wizzlewhack,  
The Jim-Jam clans their ale did jingle,  
“Plink! Ploof!” they cheered, with tankard-clack,  
As snazzlepups danced the jim-jam’s wrangle.  

So let this tale of briny broil  
Be told when wuggle-eyes get wide,  
That when你 walk through grume’s thick soil,  
*And beware the Creep of Crinkledeep.*

**The Awl and the Jabberflick**  

Beware the Jabberflick, my son!  
The jaws that jaggle, gems that glim—  
With *shriekles* when the dusk is done,  
It gobbles grommits, gulp and slim.  

Take thou the Awl of Snickersteel,  
Its v려wn haft all whorl’d with vim,  
Clinkles keen, with *thrum* unseal—  
’Twill stitch the brute to bramble-him!  

He chanced upon the Frumious Fen,  
Where Flishes flolloped, froth and fume,  
The Jabberflick *squelch*-ed, eyes agen,  
Jowls jingling with mortal tune.  

“Beware, thou Awl of Whirlibangs!”  
It *thwummed* with wrath, all teeth awhir—  
But thrust he—*shnk*—through snickering clangs,  
And left it shrunk to shrivel-whir.  

He tottered home, the stars all *tchink*,  
With Awl still clutched (no ghoul could thieve),  
The Flumplenooks did *chime* and blink:  
“He slew it! See the blabber-leave!”  

Beware the Jabberflick, my son!

With *shriekles* when the dusk is done,  
Now stitch thy triumph through the frame.

The Snicker-Snack of Crave and Bent  
Beware the crave and bent, my son,  
The mimsy maulwyrms’ squelch-shriek,  
The whatzit wants that’s never done—  
“Shall I dare the shimmerslith meek?”  

Take jingle-plated boots of whim,

The snicker-snack of crave and cracks!

Where grumblethorn and flickerflax

You snicker-slash its glimmerhide,  
The maulwyrms’ wail, a squelch-shriek,  
As bend and crave in thwartwise glide…  
The snicker-snack of bend and shriek!  

Now heed the path where zingpocket’s laid,  
Glowgrack stones hum triumph-fling—  
“Beware the crave and bend,” they’ve said,  
“Yet here’s my zing where bent would sing!”  

So quaff Zarfblatt’s froth that’s zing,  
The snicker-snack of crave and cracks,  
For what’s a want but wugga-wumps wing?  
The snicker-snack of bend and cracks!

**The Fogwraith’s Folly**  
Beware the dawn’s *mistlepaws*, my lad,  
The *fogwraith* squelches, gurgle by gleam.  
Till snick and snicker-snacks be had—  
“Seize *glimmergut* blade!” the winds do scream.  

A *snarflesnout* blade of tink and twang!  
As *fumewisp* coils through reed and root,  
The *mistyhump* licks the morn’s first clang—  
“Plunge *thunderpelt*!” shouts the hooting toot.  

The fog *sworlds* high where the *vaporgnash*  
Breeds *fizzlethroats*, froth-born and fat.  
It *thwip*s! It *squelch*es! Now clash by clash—  
“Down with the *frothjaws*!” Jab, thrust, and chat!  

*Bloop-gloop*! The *gloomwurm* hisses *piffle*…  
The fog *wheeezes*, retreating low.  
“Huzzah!” shout the *snickerkin* riffle,  
As *fizzlepop* drowns the dying *wroah*.  

So *fumewisp* fades, yet heed this rhyme—  
Beware the dawn’s *mistlepaws*, my lad!  
For where the *thunderpelt* chimes in chime,  
The *fogwraith*… well, *he’s* not quite so sad.  
*Fizzlecrack* hums. Now *fizzypop*’s played.  
The *merryplanted* all *thrum* and chime.  
Beware the dawn’s—ah, the fog’s but shade…  
But *glimmergut* blades? *Still* steeped in *slorple*s and grime.

**Third Rail's Thrum**  

Beware the third rail’s thrum, so low,  
That glints in tunnel’s glossy gloom,  
It frazzles.concurrent souls who go  
To poke the rails with thumb of doom!  

With volt-twine wrapped and shockstave bright,  
In rubbermail, they front the fray,  
They glide where subsonic currents bite,  
“To trip the third rail—fools, away!”  

O mark the Voltjaws, jaws agape,  
Its copper fangs in sizzle-snarl,  
It gapes for sparks, a hungered shape,  
As hums the rail through darkling curl.  

“Charge close!” the bravo gasps. “Now, zing—  
Zzt! Zzt! The shockstave hisses wide,  
The Voltjaws crackled, frayed, took wing,  
A pop of blue, a sputtered hide!”  

What thrum resounds, now fangs are still?  
The victor vaults to upper air,  
They cheer where glitzy rails hum thrill,  
As he tosses shockstave, void of care.  

Beware the third rail’s thrum, so low—  
The Circuit’s songs still pulse below.

**Bleedburnock**  

Beware the Vlixplume, my son,  
With glit-splorch on its face;

Till menus mar the screen’s soft hush—

And wield the Pixelbane blade;  
Through snickerflares where grimpers throng,  
Seek out the Frumious Fern displayed—  
*Beware the flick’r’s venomed shade!*  
The GPU’s안ITOR neighs.  

 A thunderplink! A shimmercrack!  
The Burn-in Beast comes crawling near,  
Molten maw, static claws, pixel-back,  
Fizzle-hiss from its jagged ear.  
“Snurk!” I shout, and slash, slash, *there*—  
Phosphor screams smear!  

 It dies with screech of *burnt* decay,  
The screen sighs clear, no phantom stain.  
Lo! Floopenbeans dance, chirr-chray,  
As backlight blooms the fields again.  
“Да! Д.getActive!” they chime-churl, trilled—  
My retinas reign!  

Beware the Burn-in’s bane, I’ve learned,

*Beware the screen’s* candent *surprise*.

**The Burblewock’s Refrain**  

“Beware the Glintsire’s moon-mired sneer,

**Déjà Vu's Frabjous Snare**  

Oh, when the Snickerwraith whispers low,  
"Beware the chronal's looping seam—  
Tick-tock, thrum, and *whirr* it go,  
Lest time's teeth gnaw through dream."  

"Arm with syrinx-sword of sprit,  
Shield of mirrored meridian!"  
Click, clack, slide, and *hiss*—a flit  
Of Mnemosyne's serpentine spawn,  

Through glimmerglen where moments clot,  
The Cronleech stalks with jaws agleam.  
Squelch, scrab, and *fwip*—now *thwunk* its knot!  
"ubsurd!" roared in fractured gleam.  

So back we strode, with shard of *then*,  
Floop, floam, and *fizzle*—beast undone!  
The froth-wrights feasted, quenched, and when  
Dawn globbered gold, we fleeted home.  

But o, when familiar dread does creep,  
Beware the Snickerwraith's grin—  
For time's teeth gnaw through dream… and *sleep*  
In loopéd loops begins again!

**The Mimsy Melodium**  

Beware the Snicker-Snout, my ear,  
that squelchle-sings in Gloomloom air,  
where flumplenooks in discords sneer—  
it jinglewiffs the timbre there.  

Take Fiddlestorm with Thrumwhack string,  
and shake the Mellowflutes in place,  
when Rattlebalm’s bright zing-zang clings,  
twang-a-ting through Wuggle’s maze.  

Beware the glorp of Cacophite—  
a Tham stewed in screechleth brew,  
but pluck the Zithercog’s chrome spire—  
*bim-bam*! The foulsong splits in two.  

He chortled, hand on Humdrum’s helm,  
as Mellotronix reared its many snares,  
till—*Squawkle-Zip*! *Zing-plop*—quelled in them,  
it droned a lull to its own scares.  

Back came the fiddlers, tweedle-deft,  
with tremoles that glimmered green,  
and Glockenblah’s tinny *chime-spray* left  
a hum-a-zing where dissonance gleaned.  

And whether Snicker-Snout’s at rest,  
or Mimsy Melodium stirs again,  
the fiddles hum the jubblence best:  
twang-a-ting through Wuggle’s maze.

**Layover Bay’s Frumious Fright**  
Beware the Flibloom’s *fizzled snare*—  
Through sunless slopes of Slumbermere,  
The *splay*-toothed Glintwings *glorp* and lair.  
Beware the *Yowel*’s midnight glare!  

Take *Zhilak’s* cloak of *shred* and streak,  
Through *thwam*ling reeds where *gloop*worms suck,  
And *Glintcleave* blade with *flarp* to seek  
The *Yowler* born of shadow-shrieked dusk.  

You *swoooped* the Cragglets, *thwum* by *thwam*,  
Where *Flumplenooks* in *gurgle* pits  
Did *tisk* and *tock* with many a *wham*—  
Till *Yowel* rose in *shriek* of *flits*!  

*Yowel* came *snerk* with *jaws agape*,  
*Plink*-*plank*-*plook* its *gizzard* grinned.  
You *thwack* its *glimmergut*—what a *yelp*!  
*Yowel* fizzed, *flopped* in *guttering gloam*…  

Now *froth*-horns bray on *jubblies* bright,  
As you *whee* down safe to Slumbermere,  
With *Zhilak*’s cloak all *shred* in *streak*…  
And Layover Bay’s *frumious*—*still there*.

**The Jabberroom**  

Beware the Flumplenook’s frumious flickers—  
whiffling through wires, a wizzle whim whirrs.  
“Beware the Glintzenclaw’s glug-glug giggers!”  
The VC Snark slept through meetings that blur.  

He grasped a Verpalmouse by vorken handles,  
snicker-snack went the pixels in rows.  
Blerchits bloomed where the bandwidth dismantles—  
“Dash the jingle-jaws! Jab the crypto-throes!”  

Down to the server’s sulfurous slammer,  
where bytes go to brawl in flailing foams,  
he slew the Glintzenclaw with a squelch and a gurgle—  
“Foom! Its bandwidth’s a puddle of moans!”  

Back through the firewall’s frothy fanfare,  
Gallimaufry gleamed with gilded flimflam.  
“Flarp the flumplenux!” (or thus went the blare—  
*ping* went the pips, *dong* went the jam.)  

Aloft in the conference room’s clash and bray,  
the Jabberroom’s jaws still gape, gleam, and garble.  
*Beware the Flumplenook’s frumious flickers—*  
the bray’s back to *burble*. Now dodge the next snarl.

**The Mawling Awl**  

Beware the Mawling Awl, my son,  
With eyes like glim-gleam spikes,  
It stabs through snicker-snatch, undone,  
As warp-woof lurches, lurches, hikes.  

Take Glibble’s glop, the thrum-needles fine,  
Through frumious snorths they’ll slip.  
Beware the Jabblejaws’ whine—  
“Snicker-snarl!”—as claws drip, drip.  

He sought the Frizzle-Thread worm,  
That gnawed the wuggle’s toe,  
When *squelch!* the Awl’s pith-storm  
Spat gizzard-glop to show:  

“THWACK-SNICK!” The Mawling reared,  
Its beak a fang of spite.  
The Awl’s keen *shlish* appeared—  
Till glorp-goo blotted light.  

He soused through Valtz’s vorple maze,  
Where glum-shrooms loom, all wet,  
Till *chink*, the slug’s glazzle daze  
Meant beastie’s wizzle-met.  

Now crowned with jinkle-placks, he’ll tout,

**The Clickwyrm's Toll**  

Oh, list to the lens, beware lens-born woe,  
When shuttersnip serpents in shadow grow—

 prepares with optic orbs, keenly ground,

Yet9199 mégapix whisper—*Hark!*—“What’s unclean

poem:
Underpass Echoes (A Jabberwocky Ballad)

In the underpass, a warning-wind begins to twine,
Rattle-rails riddle loud, stitching pockets of dark.
Crumble-sprites hiss and hum, a cautious twine,
Step softly, for the edge of night gleams in the dark.

Brindlewaugh the Echowolf pads in with a measured tone,
We rig prep-rituals, wind-charm ledgers aimed toward the dark.
Prepariel charms and lace-spun plans are spun in tone,
Boots beat brave-time, bracing breath against the bark of dark.

The Brindlewaugh snorts, nose-nad and hiss-howl, drums the tunnel-tone,
We clash with verse-saber, clang-clack, sizzle-snap against dark.
Glimmer-glyphs glow on bone-sheathe, fear folding into tone,
At last the beast yields, banished by rhyme, the corridor dark.

Back into daylight we drift, drums and doves in tonic tone,
Lantern-lilts rise; we toast the trek with a jubilant dark.
Kinfolk sing the tale in brass-bells-tone,
And the opening warning returns—soft and sly within the dark.

I swept my minuteblade to slice the jargon-jungle’s duct,
The chairs went crack-ka-crack.

I thrust my pointer-pike; the beast unspooled its cords with howl,
Zap-zap, the slide-lamps flared,
A thud-thrum, thunk! The tanglesnout unknotted into scowl,
Its logos lost and bared.

Back through the swivel sea I strode; the buzzboard dimmed its tone,
The vents went whirr-hooray,
We signed the signables; the donuts bobbed; no minutesmire to moan,
A ripple-rattle hooray.

In conference bloom the clickers clicked; the buzzboard hummed, unboomed,
The swivel sea sat still,
The time-tone tucked; the talk-track flowed; no hushle-fret perfumed—
No more the Conferox; the vents purr chill.

poem:
The Awl and the Sneedlebeast

At knurling dusk the cobbles creak,
skritch-scratch—the awls all hush;
Beware the Sneedlebeast of Bleak,
its pin-dust prickle-rush.

It snick-snick nips at button-bones,
a poke-wrought pricklemore;
O shun its needle-knuckled groans,
its tap-tap tatter-roar.

I took my grandsire's leather awl,
the stitchstar, awlbright keen;
I wrapped the haft in bridle thrall,
with whirr-whip waxen sheen.

I whet its nib to nibblepoints,
skreek-skraak—a sparking plea;
I prayed to Punchcraft, Pinch-joined Joints,
O keep my piercekin free.

Through stitchweed lanes and awning gloom,
I heard its tittle-tap;
The Sneedlebeast came prickle-bloom,
skirl, skirl—a pincersnap!

It quill-quaked close with pucker-snout,
a zip-zap zipper-gnash;
I sidled, set the awl-point out,
then THUNK!—a stitchfire flash.

I pried its prickle-valves apart,
snap-snup, the punctures sang;
The stitchstar found its skittered heart,
ping-pang—the poplifang.

I lugged the husk through loop-lamp lanes,
and folk went trum and cheer;
We jigged a jolly awldom strain,
clink-clank of cups and gear.

At knurling dawn the cobbles creak,
skritch-scratch—the awls don't hush;
No more the Sneedlebeast of Bleak,
just pin-bright peery-rush.

poem:
Creepshade Canticle

Heed hush-lanes where the creeplings creep,
skritch-skrat beneath the stoop;
While thrum-breeze worries hearthbound sleep,
and gutters glup and droop.

I gripped my glimmercutter blade,
clink-clank the buckles bit;
And donned a duskproof drabrigade,
skree-skree the torches lit.

Out slouched Zreegal Creep-from-Under,
shush-hiss the briars swayed;
Its blinkblot eyes went thun-blunder,
skreek! skraw! my courage brayed.

I twirl-whipped forth the flickerflay,
zip-zap the shadows split;
and gave Zreegal a flinderslay,
thok-thak! its night-heart quit.

Back down the hush-lanes, creeplings creep,
hurroo hurroo! the kettles whoop;
Yet hearths unquiver into sleep,
skirl-spark beside the stoop.

poem:
The Yearnloper and the Desire Path

Beware the wish-worn Wanderway,
The Yearnloper will bite;
That desire path will woo your stray,
Hear hedge-hiss in the night.

I packed my brave in heartpack-pack,
That click-clacked in low light;
A mythmap, mumblecharm, and knack,
And shoegreaves cinched up tight.

I raised my trusty brambleblade,
The breeze went hush-hush-hush;
The Yearnloper, in wantglade shade,
Skree-skraw! It stilled to hush.

I sang back down the Wanderway,
O wantless day, alight;
Yet sly, that sidewise desireway,
So mind your steps at night.

poem:
Mizzlewump of Morning Fog

When wan day-drums arise in haze,
soft-soft the hedgerows hush;
beware the Mizzlewump in maze,
it sips the morning mush.

I fetched my dewblade, glim of steel,
clink-clack the buckles click,
and donned a fogmask, fernish-feel,
with windsong’s whirring tick.

The marshpaths mumble, milk-gray gloom,
swish-swish the sedges sway;
out slurks the Mizzlewump—mire-bloom—
its drip-drop jaws say, “Pray?”

I skirl my dewblade: clack-clack-clack,
the fen-fern folded rows;
I swing a dawnbrand, skitter-slak,
thwack-thwack through mallow mows.

The Mizzlewump gave gurgle-yell,
splosh-splosh in sodden bog;
I nicked its knurl and nixed the spell,
then hush, unhooding fog.

Back over brinks of bracken-braid,
ring-ding the village bell;
they crown my dewblade, dawn-parade,
hip-hip, huzza it fell!

When wan day-drums arise in haze,
soft-soft the hedgerows hush;
remember Mizzlewumps in maze,
and sip your morning mush.

poem:
Thrumthrax and the Third-Rail Thrum

Beware the third-rail thrumming gloom,
zzzap and zizz by subway seam;
For Thrumthrax skirls in sparkgloom bloom,
brrr-hum-brrrum beneath the beam.

I donned my gafferhide and hood,
click-clack my insulboots;
With coilhook-crook and copperwood,
skreek-skrak through railroots.

Out surged the Thrumthrax, flashwing snare,
shaaah! the tunnels shook;

tchak-tchak—my coilhook took.

Its volt-venom veered, a viper flare,
zzz-RAK! my visor rang;
I split its humheart, bright and bare,
krrr-klick—the silence sang.

Back up the platforms, tunnelkin cheered,
hup-hup the brakemen thrum;
We clinked rail-ale, our sparkfête weird,
bum-bum, brrr-brrr—the city thrum.

Yet still the third-rail thrums in gloom,
zzzap and zizz by emberseam;
Recall the Thrumthrax’s humdoom bloom—
brrr-hum-brrrum beneath the beam.

poem:
The Grizzleframe of Shuttergulch

At dimmerdawn the filmfolk warn
of Grainwyrm Grizzleframe;
it whishes wide with shutter-scorn,
and ghosts your reels with flame.

I primed my sprocklebox of brass—
click-CLACK!—the spoolings wound;
with flashfang, f-stop falchion glass,
and Trueshank tripod ground.

Down Shuttergulch came Grizzleframe,
huff-hissing, grain and glare;
its tinsel-teeth took aim at flame—
I raised my lens to snare.

Ker-CHAK! the shutter shivered twice,
the sprockets zinged in flight;
I loosed a light-net, cold as ice,
and pinned it to the night.

Grizzleframe gave a blurted blare,
skraaa—skritch—skrawl of dread;
its hiss unspooled to silver air,
then stilled to film-fed dead.

Home hied I through the fixer's fume,
the darkroom chimed ker-plink;
we beat the beakers—bloop and boom—
and sang the silver-splink.

At dimmerdawn, the filmfolk cheer,
no Grizzleframe to claim;
take heart, ye shutterlings, never fear—
we ghosted it with flame.
